DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Procedimentos de Execução e Análise de Pavimentos Experimentais Reforçados com Geossintéticos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: Associação Brasileira de Mecanica dos Solos

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIDAL, D. M.;DE MATTOS VIDAL, D.;VIDAL, D.M.;VIDAL, D.;MATTOS VIDAL, D.;Vidal, Delma;MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;DE MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;MATTOS VIDAL;Vidal, D.;Vidal, Delma de Mattos;MATTOS VIDAL,

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O pavimento é uma estrutura bastante complexa no que diz respeito ao seu dimensionamento e à previsão de seu desempenho futuro, por ser dependente da interação de uma série de fatores, tais como: tráfego, clima, processos construtivos, condições de drenagem, estrutura do pavimento e materiais de construção utilizados. Como consequência, os métodos de dimensionamento existentes são, de forma geral, de natureza empírica. Atualmente, há uma crescente aplicação de geossintéticos no reforço de bases e sub-bases em obras viárias pois permitem elaborar projetos otimizados, com redução da espessura das camadas do pavimento e do tempo de execução da obra, com uma melhor compactação da camada reforçada, além de um melhor controle de qualidade de todo o processo, gerando uma boa relação custo-benefício. A inclusão do geossintético nos métodos de dimensionamento de pavimentos pode ser realizada pela inclusão de parâmetros, que quantificam o ganho estrutural obtido pelo uso do reforço, nos métodos de dimensionamento tradicionais. Desta forma, mostra-se necessário a obtenção de um conjunto de dados que possibilitem a calibração experimental dos métodos de dimensionamento em função dos diversos fatores que influenciam no seu desempenho. Neste trabalho são apresentadas algumas recomendações relativas à execução e análise de pavimentos experimentais, em verdadeira grandeza. Estas recomendações resultam da análise de dois trechos experimentais, sendo o primeiro executado por Cancelli e Montanelli (1999) e o segundo acompanhado pelos autores deste trabalho na Rodovia Presidente Dutra.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Mechanical behavior of a PVC geosynthetic barrierexhumed from an industrial waste disposal trench
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Mechanical behavior of a PVC geosynthetic barrierexhumed from an industrial waste disposal trench

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIDAL, D. M.;DE MATTOS VIDAL, D.;VIDAL, D.M.;VIDAL, D.;MATTOS VIDAL, D.;Vidal, Delma;MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;DE MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;MATTOS VIDAL;Vidal, D.;Vidal, Delma de Mattos;MATTOS VIDAL,

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Coleta, tratamento e disposição de resíduos; recuperação de materiais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Thickness, mass per unit area, hardness and axial tension tests were performed on specimens of a polyvinyl chloride (PVC) geomembrane exhumed from the lining system of a waste disposal trench after 20 years of operation. The results were compared to reference values pertaining to control samples. Tension test results on the aged specimens revealed reductions in strain at failure reaching 10 % and 25 %, for specimens previously classified visually as ?good? and ?stained?, respectively. Hardness test results indicated an in-crease in geomembrane hardness (Shore A) ranging from 9 to 12 %. The results are consistent with the effect of ?ageing? due to plasticizer loss, affecting the long-term behavior of PVC geomembranes by increasing the stiffness of the material. However, the obtained results also illustrate the fact that the extent of long-term stiffening is a function of material quality (plasticizer, additives) and environmental conditions, and cannot be simply generalized for different products under different environments. The present test results indicated a small variation in geomembrane mechanical properties after 20 years, suggesting that the material was ex-posed to an environment that was not critically aggressive.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Thickness, mass per unit area, hardness and axial tension tests were performed on specimens of a polyvinyl chloride (PVC) geomembrane exhumed from the lining system of a waste disposal trench after 20 years of operation. The results were compared to reference values pertaining to control samples. Tension test results on the aged specimens revealed reductions in strain at failure reaching 10 % and 25 %, for specimens previously classified visually as ?good? and ?stained?, respectively. Hardness test results indicated an in-crease in geomembrane hardness (Shore A) ranging from 9 to 12 %. The results are consistent with the effect of ?ageing? due to plasticizer loss, affecting the long-term behavior of PVC geomembranes by increasing the stiffness of the material. However, the obtained results also illustrate the fact that the extent of long-term stiffening is a function of material quality (plasticizer, additives) and environmental conditions, and cannot be simply generalized for different products under different environments. The present test results indicated a small variation in geomembrane mechanical properties after 20 years, suggesting that the material was ex-posed to an environment that was not critically aggressive.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIDAL, D. M.;DE MATTOS VIDAL, D.;VIDAL, D.M.;VIDAL, D.;MATTOS VIDAL, D.;Vidal, Delma;MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;DE MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;MATTOS VIDAL;Vidal, D.;Vidal, Delma de Mattos;MATTOS VIDAL,

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Geosynthetics acting as pavement base and sub-base reinforcement have been a well-accepted practice due to the advantages offered by these products, which increase the pavement life-time or reduce the pavement layers thickness. The paper discusses the approaches for evaluate the geosynthetics benefits in pavement reinforcement, considering the TBR (Traffic Benefit Ratio) and the LCR (Layer Coefficient Ratio) concepts, applied to the modified AASHTO method. TBR and LCR were estimated from the results obtained in a full scale study conducted in several reinforced and non-reinforced pavement sections, to evaluate the influence of the variables as the sub-grade condition, the base thickness, the reinforcement characteristics and the number of Equivalent Axial Loads (EAL) related to specifics rutting depth. In this case, TBR and LCR values can be evaluated en function of the number of Equivalent Axial Loads (EAL) observed for a specific rutting depth considering reinforced and non reinforced sections. The values obtained show that the TBR parameter decreases when the considered rutting depth increases as expected, but some results leads to an excessive augmentation of the TBR value which could be unrealistic. LCR analysis should be preferable to evaluate the geosynthetics influence in the pavement structure and life time.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O processo de implantação de concessões rodoviárias iniciou-se no Brasil em 1995, com uma parceria entre o governo federal e os governos estaduais, dando continuidade ao processo de descentralização das atividades do Estado na área de transportes. Através das concessões, o Estado transfere à iniciativa privada a prestação de determinados serviços que, apesar de essenciais à sociedade, não precisam necessariamente ser oferecidos pelo poder público. As concessionárias, empresas responsáveis pela administração das rodovias, passam a responder pelo bom funcionamento da via e o conforto dos usuários, garantindo que os serviços relacionados à manutenção e implantação de obras sejam executados com qualidade, agilidade e segurança. Para atender estes objetivos precisam implementar um eficiente Sistema de Gerência e, neste contexto, um laboratório de ensaios capaz de atender as necessidades da concessionária nas fases de implantação, manutenção e monitoramento das obras é um dos pilares para a garantia de qualidade deste sistema. O artigo proposto pretende apresentar e discutir os requisitos básicos para implantação e operação de laboratórios de ensaios em concessões rodoviárias e aeroportuárias abordando temas como o fluxograma de implantação e funcionamento, características e exigências para os diversos laboratórios associados, importância e requisitos do banco de dados, ensaios necessários e controle de qualidade.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The deployment process for Brazilian highway concessions began in 1995 with a partnership between the federal and state governments continuing the process of decentralization of state activities in the transport area. Through of concessions the State transfers it to the private sector to provide a range of services that although are essential to society, do not need necessarily to be offered by public authorities. The concessions, the companies responsible for the roads become responsive by the operation of the road and comfort to the user, ensuring that services related to maintenance and deployment to be executed with quality, agility and safety. To meet these objectives need to implement an efficient system of management and in this context, a laboratory testing able of meeting the needs of the concessions during the deployment, maintenance and monitoring of the works is one of the pillars for quality assurance this system. The proposed article aims to present and discuss the basic requirements for deployment and operation of testing laboratories for airport and highway concessions covering the implementation and operation flowchart, character and requirements for the various laboratories associated importance and requirements of the database, the several tests needed and the quality control.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Água, esgoto, atividades de gestão de resíduos e descontaminação

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Os resíduos gerados no processo de potabilização da água são produzidos em grande
quantidade e poucas estações de tratamento no Brasil têm apresentado soluções para a sua
minimização, tratamento e correta disposição. A técnica de desaguamento de resíduos com alto teor
de líquido em relação ao teor de sólidos com emprego de geotêxteis tem se apresentado como uma
solução eficiente e viável do ponto de vista técnico e econômico para a redução de volume de
resíduo a ser disposto. O presente artigo apresenta uma análise da aplicação da técnica de
desaguamento de lodo de Estação de Tratamento de Água em sistemas fechados de geotêxteis, por
meio do emprego de protótipo que simula condições reais de enchimento. A análise dos resultados
demonstrou ser promissora a tecnologia estudada para tal finalidade, surgindo como uma alternativa
para a análise do comportamento destes sistemas na disposição desse tipo de resíduo no meio
ambiente, o qual pode ser utilizado como um sistema único ou como melhoria do sistema já
existente.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Análise dos procedimentos de ensaio para avaliação de desempenho de desaguamento utilizando bolsa de geotêxtil de pequena dimensão

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Água, esgoto, atividades de gestão de resíduos e descontaminação
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Indústrias Extrativas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: No Brasil e no mundo, obras geotécnicas e processos na indústria, mineração e saneamento geram grandes volumes de resíduo com alto teor de umidade. O lançamento deste tipo de material no meio ambiente, sem prévio tratamento, ou mesmo sua disposição em lagoas específicas, tem grande potencial de impacto ambiental, independente do grau de contaminação do sedimento. Bolsas e tubos em geotêxtil, que já vinham sendo utilizadas desde a década de 80 para controle de erosão e aterros hidráulicos ao serem preenchidas com material granular, passaram também a ser empregadas para contenção de materiais finos com alto teor de umidade, como uma das técnicas capazes de solucionar o problema da disposição de lodos e sedimentos, inclusive quando contaminados. Devido às propriedades dos geotêxteis, num projeto bem avaliado e executado, o desaguamento e a retenção das partículas desejados, bem como um efluente que necessite de pouco ou nenhum tratamento antes de seu lançamento final podem ser atingidos. Sistemas fechados com geotêxteis para desaguamento de lodos ou sedimentos permitem reduzir o impacto ambiental, reduzindo a área impactada, o volume de material a armazenar e melhorando a qualidade do efluente. Para ser uma solução segura e eficiente, ensaios de laboratório e de campo devem ser realizados para avaliar a eficiência dos sistemas de desaguamento. A partir destes ensaios é que se estabelece a necessidade, o tipo e a concentração dos condicionantes químicos que permitem obter a melhor relação retenção/desaguamento. Dentre os ensaios de campo, um dos mais difundidos é o ensaio de bolsa de pequena dimensão, sendo a proposta mais recente apresentada pelo GRI-GT15 (2009). Este ensaio é de fácil execução, porém com algumas inconvenientes que são discutidos neste artigo.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Água, esgoto, atividades de gestão de resíduos e descontaminação
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Indústrias Extrativas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Diversos processos na industria, mineração e saneamento geram resíduos ou rejeitos com grande volume de liquido em relação ao de sólidos que, se lançados diretamente na natureza, em lagoas ou corpos d?água, causam grande impacto ambiental. Obras geotécnicas e de proteção ambiental tambéem se deparam com a necessidade de dispor sedimentos, contaminados ou não, com alto teor de umidade. Uma nova tecnologia de disposição para estes maateriais vem sendo empregada nas últimas décadas - a técnica de desaguamento do material confinado por meio de filtros geotêxteis. A disposição dos sedimentos, resíduos ou rejeitos em bolsas ou tubos feitos de geotêxtil, garante o confinamento do material retido e evita a penetração de água de chuva, acelerando o desaguamento. Além disto, o processo, por suas caracteristicas filtrantes, permite que o efluente necessite de pouco ou nenhum tratamento antes de seu lançamento final. Este procedimento, além de mais seguro é bastante viável, se comparado aos métodos comumente utilizados, visto que permite uma rápida disposição de grande volume de material, com fácil execução, baixo custo, alta eficiência e baixo impacto ambiental. Ensaios de laboratório e campo têrm sido propostos na última década para melhor conhecimento do desempenho e eficácia destes sistemas. Dentre os ensaios propostos destacam-se os ensaios de cone e de bolsa, para análise da eficiência de filtração e desaguamento. O artigo proposto discute os princípios da técnica e dos ensaios e os procedimentos propostos a partir de resultados de testes em bolsas confeccionadas por distintos geotêxteis (dois tecidos e um não tecido), considerando material granular, argiloso e um lodo de estação de tratamento de água, com e sem condicionamento químico.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Coleta, tratamento e disposição de resíduos; recuperação de materiais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT Filter elements employed in landfills leachate drainage systems are submitted to severe risks of clogging by physical, chemical and biological process. Field and laboratory studies are necessary to evaluate the filter behavior in these critical conditions and to increase knowledge about long term performance and design methods. The paper discusses some techniques that could be employed to analyze clogged specimens submitted to leachate percolation and describes their procedure. Methods to evaluate the percentage of or-ganic and inorganic adhering matter, the permeability reduction and SEM (Scanning Electronic Microscopy) analyses are presented. The adhering matter is analyzed by calcination of the matter obtained after special washing. The permeability reduction is evaluated by special tests at constant hydraulic charge.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT Filter elements employed in landfills leachate drainage systems are submitted to severe risks of clogging by physical, chemical and biological process. Field and laboratory studies are necessary to evaluate the filter behavior in these critical conditions and to increase knowledge about long term performance and design methods. The paper discusses some techniques that could be employed to analyze clogged specimens submitted to leachate percolation and describes their procedure. Methods to evaluate the percentage of or-ganic and inorganic adhering matter, the permeability reduction and SEM (Scanning Electronic Microscopy) analyses are presented. The adhering matter is analyzed by calcination of the matter obtained after special washing. The permeability reduction is evaluated by special tests at constant hydraulic charge.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Descontaminação e outros serviços de gestão de resíduos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT The use of Geotextile Closed Systems (GTX-CS) had a significant increase in recent years. Systems in form of tubes or bags have been employed to retain or dewatering sediments, rejects or sludge, contaminated or not. With this increase is also growing the need of tests that allow evaluating the systems behavior. The paper discusses the available techniques employed in these tests, including the small scale geotextile bag test proposed by GRI-GT15 (2009). Among the propositions, the cone test and the small bag test can be considered important adjuncts to making design decisions. The analyses conducted to assess the procedures indicate that the tests are easy to perform, but some drawbacks have been observed. This work discusses these aspects and suggests new procedures to these tests.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT The use of Geotextile Closed Systems (GTX-CS) had a significant increase in recent years. Systems in form of tubes or bags have been employed to retain or dewatering sediments, rejects or sludge, contaminated or not. With this increase is also growing the need of tests that allow evaluating the systems behavior. The paper discusses the available techniques employed in these tests, including the small scale geotextile bag test proposed by GRI-GT15 (2009). Among the propositions, the cone test and the small bag test can be considered important adjuncts to making design decisions. The analyses conducted to assess the procedures indicate that the tests are easy to perform, but some drawbacks have been observed. This work discusses these aspects and suggests new procedures to these tests.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Evaluation of the geotextiles biological clogging in experimental cells
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Evaluation of the geotezxtiles biological clogging in experimental cells

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Second Pan American Geosynthetics Conference & Exhibition GeoAmericas 2012

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIDAL, D. M.;DE MATTOS VIDAL, D.;VIDAL, D.M.;VIDAL, D.;MATTOS VIDAL, D.;Vidal, Delma;MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;DE MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;MATTOS VIDAL;Vidal, D.;Vidal, Delma de Mattos;MATTOS VIDAL,

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Coleta, tratamento e disposição de resíduos; recuperação de materiais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT The work presents the adopted procedure and some results of a research evaluating clogging process associated to geotextile filters elements acting in urban solid waste facilities. Sixteen cylindrical experimental cells, with diameter of 58cm, were assembled in a special local in the São José dos Campos landfill (Brazil). Each cell was composed for a gravel layer of 25cm, a geotextile filter and over the filter the urban solid waste slightly compacted up to 45cm height. After the waste compaction the cells were closed and connected to a gas drainage system and to a leachate supply system. The leachate levels, the temperatures in the waste zone and the flow of leachate out of the cells were monitored throughout the experiment. Three different geotextiles ? two woven geotextiles and one nonwoven geotextile were employed. The cells had been protected to the direct solar radiation but exposed to the ambient temperature. After 224 days the experimental cells were opened and the filters and drains carefully exposed. Samples were pictured and conducted to the laboratory to be analyzed and tested. All cells have presented clogging process, at different levels.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Slope Contingencies on BR-376 / PR

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: VI Conferencia Brasileira de Encostas - COBRAE 2013
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: Associação Brasileira de Mecanica dos solos - ABMS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O traçado de rodovias situadas na região da Serra do Mar e a concepção de taludes em
corte e em aterro impactam diretamente na análise e nos cuidados que devem ser adotados para
prevenção de escorregamentos. Com a adoção de um banco de dados com o mapeamento de trechos
críticos nas rodovias e um banco de soluções de estabilização de encostas é possível mitigar a
ocorrência de eventos, muitas vezes catastróficos. Este trabalho discute a importância de um banco
de dados para monitoramento e como ele pode favorecer regiões comumente afetadas por
deslizamentos, de forma que as contingências a serem adotadas nas rodovias que perpassam a Serra
do Mar priorizem a segurança do usuário, e venham ao encontro das necessidades de fluidez e
trafegabilidade imprescindíveis para o escoamento da economia do país.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Unsaturated flow behavior of leak-detection systems with geonets
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Unsaturated flow behavior of leak-detection systems with geonets

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A critical element in the proper functioning of a pond or landfill to dispose hazardous liquids and solid wastes is the containment system. For solid-waste landfills, a leachate collection and removal system must be above the uppermost liner, and in cases of a double liner, a leak-detection system is needed between the primary and secondary liner (Koerner 2012). Disposal of dangerous liquids in ponds also require double liner and leak-detection. In systems designed to monitor release through liners or provide an early warning of a potential liner failure, the arrival time to detect the contaminant is essential. Hence, the primary performance goal for leak detection system is to reduce the leachate travel time and consequently allowing to greatly reducing the time to detection. Geosynthetics are usually employed to compose the drain in leak-detection systems. However, its hydraulic behavior for this application requires further re-search, especially in unsaturated conditions. The aim of this paper is to discuss the phenomena that influ-ence the percolation in a synthetic unsaturated media, like the hydrophobia. Special concern must be placed in the selection of nonwoven geotextiles acting as protection layer, outlining that products that pre-sent a hydrophilic behavior, in relation to the percolating fluid, should be avoided.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A critical element in the proper functioning of a pond or landfill to dispose hazardous liquids and solid wastes is the containment system. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Some aspects of the durability testing for geosynthetics exposed to climatic degradation agents
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Some aspects of the durability testing for geosynthetics exposed to climatic degradation agents

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Coleta, tratamento e disposição de resíduos; recuperação de materiais
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Pesquisa e desenvolvimento científico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The durability analysis of a geosynthetic is an important aspect to be considered during the evaluation of its acceptability for geotechnical, civil engineering and environmental applications, due to prolonged contact of these materials with aging agents. Geosynthetic exposure to climatic agent, particularly ultraviolet radiation, can suffer degradation. The paper discusses the assessment of the geosynthetics durability to climatic agents accomplished by outdoor testing and accelerated weathering laboratory tests. The outdoors tests are affected by local conditions as UV radiance, latitude, steepness, climate, tempera-ture, rainfall intensity and air conditions, mainly pollution and particulate matter. Laboratory tests are af-fected by the UV radiation level, specimen surface temperature, cycle period and type. To exemplify some of the discussed aspects, results of tests realized with a polyvinyl chloride geosynthetic barrier developed to be applied in biodigester covers, exposed at three different regions in Brazil are presented. The selected regions were: Embu das Artes -SP (23° 38' 56" S 46° 51' 07" W), with a subtropical climate; Camaçari - BA (12° 41' 52" S 38° 19' 26" W), with a tropical wet climate, and Petrolina- PE (9° 23' 34" S 40° 30' 28" W), with a tropical semiarid climate.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The durability analysis of a geosynthetic is an important aspect to be considered during the evaluation of its acceptability for geotechnical, civil engineering and environmental applications, due to prolonged contact of these materials with aging agents. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Aspectos do Dimensionamento e Eficiência das Barreiras de Sedimentos
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Aspects of Design and Efficiency of Silt Fences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O trabalho apresenta uma análise dos mecanismos relacionados ao funcionamento da barreira de sedimentos em geotêxtil, aplicada no controle de processos de erosão superficial e carreamento de partículas de solo solto, discutindo os aspectos relevantes a serem considerados no dimensionamento do sistema. Além das características físicas e mecânicas do geotêxtil são analisadas a influência dos fatores ambientais e topográficos do local de utilização, que geram parâmetros importantes a serem considerados na instalação e manutenção, seja ela permanente ou temporária. Em uma análise dos problemas observados em obras decorrentes de dimensionamento, instalação ou manutenção inadequadas das barreiras de sedimentos, busca-se melhorar a eficiência da barreira de sedimentos como um sistema correspondente a demanda de obras geotécnicas com potencial agressor ao meio ambiente e aos sistemas circunvizinhos a obra, devido ao carreamento indesejado de solo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Efficiency and designing aspects of geotextile tubes for sludge dewatering in water treatment plants
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Efficiency and designing aspects of geotextile tubes for sludge dewatering in water treatment plants

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: First International Conference on Technology and Application of Geosynthetics

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Chemicals are usually applied during water potabilization in order to promote coagulation by destabilizing colloidal particles, reducing surface repulsion forces, and to allow forming the flocs to easily sediment fine particles. Sludge generated at water treatment plant (WTP) is a high moisture content residue that consists of impurities present in raw water, coagulants and other chemicals used in the process. Dewatering this residue in geotextile tubes can significantly reduce its volume, facilitating its handling and final disposal. This paper reviews the current state of the practice in designing with geotextile closed systems for dewatering of WTP sludge, and the mechanisms related to its operation, addressing relevant aspects to be considered in the system design, such as the influencing factors on the filtration and dewatering efficiencies. Experimental methods, such as the dewatering cone test and the geotextile dewatering bag (GDB), usually conducted to select the most appropriate geotextile and chemical conditioning are also discussed. Thus, this work sought to expand the understanding of the WTP residue dewatering process on geotextile closed systems and to highlight the main issues involving its conception and achievement of the desired performance, in order to increase the acceptance and utilization of this technology.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Chemicals are usually applied during water potabilization in order to promote coagulation by destabilizing colloidal particles, reducing surface repulsion forces, and to allow forming the flocs to easily sediment fine particles. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Influence of water treatment plant sludge characteristics on its dewaterability in geotextile closed systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Influence of water treatment plant sludge characteristics on its dewaterability in geotextile closed systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Sludge generated at water treatment plants (WTP) is a high moisture content residue that consists basically of the impurities present in raw water, coagulants and other chemicals used in the process. Dewatering of this residue in geotextile bags or tubes can significantly reduce its volume, facilitating its handling and final disposal. In this paper, the influence of chemicals and processes involved in removing the impurities of raw water on the dewatering of the generated sludge is studied by comparing results ob-tained in cone and pillow dewatering tests. These tests were performed using sludge samples collected from two different WTP and dewatering, filtration and infiltration efficiencies were calculated and compared for each test performed. It has been found that chemicals used and processes involved in water treatment in-fluence significantly on the residue dewaterability. Results obtained from these tests allow better under-standing of the geotextile tube sludge dewatering process of water treatment plants.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Sludge generated at water treatment plants (WTP) is a high moisture content residue that consists basically of the impurities present in raw water, coagulants and other chemicals used in the process. Dewatering of this residue in geotextile bags or tubes can significantly reduce its volume, facilitating its handling and final disposal. In this paper, the influence of chemicals and processes involved in removing the impurities of raw water on the dewatering of the generated sludge is studied by comparing results ob-tained in cone and pillow dewatering tests. These tests were performed using sludge samples collected from two different WTP and dewatering, filtration and infiltration efficiencies were calculated and compared for each test performed. It has been found that chemicals used and processes involved in water treatment in-fluence significantly on the residue dewaterability. Results obtained from these tests allow better under-standing of the geotextile tube sludge dewatering process of water treatment plants.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Reinforced walls - Effect of the distance between reinforcement in the soil on reduced models
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Reinforced walls - Effect of the distance between reinforcement in the soil on reduced models

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Evaluate the influence between the reinforcement stiffness and the soil stiffness on the behavior
of soil reinforcement structures with geosynthetics can contribute to a better comprehension of the
structure mechanisms. Studies on reduced models varying the spacing between reinforced layers were realized.
The structures were submitted to a loading applied trough a footing and stress and deformations
were analyzed. The analyses of the physical models results were realized using the finite element software
PLAXIS. This work presents the analyses of three models: one reinforced material with three different
spacing between layers. As presented in the results, it is possible to observe that a change on the soil
reinforcement spacing meant an increase on the soil elasticity modulus, hence, increasing the confining
stresses on the reinforced layer. As greater the soil elasticity modulus more significant is the gain on the
confinement (iteration effect).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Evaluate the influence between the reinforcement stiffness and the soil stiffness on the behavior
of soil reinforcement structures with geosynthetics can contribute to a better comprehension of the

The structures were submitted to a loading applied trough a footing and stress and deformations
were analyzed. The analyses of the physical models results were realized using the finite element software

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A review of theoretical methods for quantifying the number of constrictions in nonwoven geotextile filters
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A review of theoretical methods for quantifying the number of constrictions in nonwoven geotextile filters

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The scientific literature shows that since 1982 several rational retention criteria for geotextile
filters have been suggested by different authors, involving diverse parameters and considerations. Few,
however, incorporate the existing number of constrictions in the geotextile manufactured plan, an important
parameter that affects the path through which a soil particle travels. The focus of this work is aimed at
delineating and discussing three rational analyses that comprise the calculation of the number of constrictions
in nonwoven geotextile filters. For each analysis, the boundary conditions used to build the theoretical
methods are described. A case study is then presented to provide a better insight as to how the number
of constrictions varies according to each approach. It becomes evident that, because two of the analyzed
propositions are essentially probabilistic, they may return an estimation of the number of constrictions necessary
to retain a defined soil particle. Thus, a comparison between the three methods is only possible if
the number of constrictions according to those probabilistic approaches is calculated by means of computing
the ratio between the geotextile thickness and the inter-constriction distance, which in turn vary from
one approach to the other. Significant discrepancies among the results from all three methods were found.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The scientific literature shows that since 1982 several rational retention criteria for geotextile
filters have been suggested by different authors, involving diverse parameters and considerations. Few,
however, incorporate the existing number of constrictions in the geotextile manufactured plan, an important
parameter that affects the path through which a soil particle travels. The focus of this work is aimed at
delineating and discussing three rational analyses that comprise the calculation of the number of constrictions
in nonwoven geotextile filters. For each analysis, the boundary conditions used to build the theoretical
methods are described. A case study is then presented to provide a better insight as to how the number
of constrictions varies according to each approach. It becomes evident that, because two of the analyzed
propositions are essentially probabilistic, they may return an estimation of the number of constrictions necessary
to retain a defined soil particle. Thus, a comparison between the three methods is only possible if
the number of constrictions according to those probabilistic approaches is calculated by means of computing

one approach to the other. Significant discrepancies among the results from all three methods were found.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Construction methodology and dimensioning of silt fences: scientific, normative and laboratorial review
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Construction methodology and dimensioning of silt fences: scientific, normative and laboratorial review

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This Article features literature review of scientific material and manuals about design, in-stallation, maintenance and singularities of the use of Silt Fences, defining it and discoursing on the mate-rials that compose it, dynamics of its operation, design procedure and ASTM standards for its use. Pre-senting the advantages of its application and the disadvantages of its poor installation, or non-use, in places where surface erosion and soil sedimentation occurs for various reasons, presenting parameters for its proper location, aiming to propose more relevant studies for its correct use in Brazil, to thereby, pro-vide better control in the final deposition of sediments, protecting water bodies, sanitation systems and more. This study was carried out with the intention of creating a recommendation of use and installation for Silt Fences, studying their performance with the use of a variety of geosynthetics to the granulometry of the Brazilian soils in question. In order to perform this study, the ASTM standards were used in tests with the proposed geosynthetics, the data obtained in these analyzes were then arranged in commented ta-bles, indicating which is the best use and in which granulometry each geosynthetic has the best perfor-mance. It is hoped, therefore, to ensure the correct use of these temporary barriers in various works, providing consultation and dimensioning material compatible with the accelerated quotidian of construc-tion sites.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This Article features literature review of scientific material and manuals about design, in-stallation, maintenance and singularities of the use of Silt Fences, defining it and discoursing on the mate-rials that compose it, dynamics of its operation, design procedure and ASTM standards for its use. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Granular Columns reinforced with Geosynthetics: an overview of employment trends
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Granular Columns reinforced with Geosynthetics: an overview of employment trends

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Geosynthetics'2013 Geosynthetics for Water and Energy Challenges

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Granular columns are vertical structural elements of dense interlocking aggregate or compacted sand, that are intended to increase the foundation overall bearing capacity and provide vertical drainage pathways to expedite the consolidation settlement. They are recognized as highly efficient and cost-effective ground improvement techniques. However the rigidity and load carrying capacity of the columns depend largely upon the amount of lateral restraint or confining stress that can be mobilized in the surrounding soft clay to avoid excessive radial deformation or even to keep the column's integrity. This additional restrain required could be provided by encapsulating the column granular backfilling in a geotextile wrapping, a technique that is referred to as geotextile-encased columns (or just GEC). The GEC represent the most wide-spread technique for improving poor ground using granular columns reinforced with geosynthetics, however other possibilities have been published, which can slightly or strongly differs from the current concept. According to some authors the reinforcement of a granular column can be also achieved by horizontal tensile elements (geosynthetic layers) either in full or partial column length, or by partial encasement of the upper column section that is prone to bulge. Another variation closely related to the conventional GEC technique is to encapsulate columns with geogrids or geocomposites. Hence, the aim of this paper is to present a broad review and a comparative analysis of the techniques proposed to reinforce granular columns with geosynthetics over the last 30 years, discussing the advantages and the feasibility of each method.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Granular columns are vertical structural elements of dense interlocking aggregate or compacted sand, that are intended to increase the foundation overall bearing capacity and provide vertical drainage pathways to expedite the consolidation settlement. They are recognized as highly efficient and cost-effective ground improvement techniques. However the rigidity and load carrying capacity of the columns depend largely upon the amount of lateral restraint or confining stress that can be mobilized in the surrounding soft clay to avoid excessive radial deformation or even to keep the column's integrity. This additional restrain required could be provided by encapsulating the column granular backfilling in a geotextile wrapping, a technique that is referred to as geotextile-encased columns (or just GEC). The GEC represent the most wide-spread technique for improving poor ground using granular columns reinforced with geosynthetics, however other possibilities have been published, which can slightly or strongly differs from the current concept. According to some authors the reinforcement of a granular column can be also achieved by horizontal tensile elements (geosynthetic layers) either in full or partial column length, or by partial encasement of the upper column section that is prone to bulge. Another variation closely related to the conventional GEC technique is to encapsulate columns with geogrids or geocomposites. Hence, the aim of this paper is to present a broad review and a comparative analysis of the techniques proposed to reinforce granular columns with geosynthetics over the last 30 years, discussing the advantages and the feasibility of each method.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Evaluation the Performance of Closed Geotextiles System for the Waste Dewatering of Water Treatment Plant (WTP) ? The Efficacy Dewatering
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Evaluation the Performance of Closed Geotextiles System for the Waste Dewatering of Water Treatment Plant (WTP) ? The Efficacy Dewatering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The waste generated in the water purifiers process are produced in large amount and contain, as particularity, great
quantities of liquid in comparison with the solids. The construction technology for dewatering waste with high content of
liquid relative to solids in closed geotextiles systems are being increasingly used as a promising method for reducing the
volume of final waste to be disposed. This paper presents an application of the technique of dewatering waste (sludge)
of Water Treatment Plant (WTP) in closed systems of geotextiles in the prototype built for simulation of a Waste
Treatment Plant. Indeed, it presents an analysis proposal of a new parameter for evaluating the performance of this
system, called Efficacy of Dewatering. Its importance lies in the analysis of system performance in terms of their ability to
remove free water present in the waste, with consequent concentration of solids and reduce its volume for final disposal.
Keywords: Dewatering, efficacy, waste.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

This paper presents an application of the technique of dewatering waste (sludge) of Water Treatment Plant (WTP) in closed systems of geotextiles in the prototype built for simulation of a Waste Treatment Plant. Indeed, it presents an analysis proposal of a new parameter for evaluating the performance of this system, called Efficacy of Dewatering. Its importance lies in the analysis of system performance in terms of their ability to
remove free water present in the waste, with consequent concentration of solids and reduce its volume for final disposal.
Keywords: Dewatering, efficacy, waste.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Water penetration resistance of geotextiles: current state of knowledge
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Water penetration resistance of geotextiles: current state of knowledge

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Soil-geotextile systems are often subject to water infiltration due to natural weather variations. When the water penetration resistance of the geotextile leads to the accumulation of water at the soil-geotextile interface, a serious problem of instability in the geotechnical structure may occur, especially in thin layers of soil such as landfill covers. Most nonwoven geotextiles have a water penetration resistance greater than 5 mm when completely cleaned and composed only of hydrophobic filaments/yarns. The evaluation of the resistance offered by the geotextile to water penetration can be useful to understand the interaction between water and geotextiles under unsaturated conditions. The purpose of the present article is to discuss the different test procedures found in the literature for the determination of water penetration resistance of geotextiles. Experimental data are presented to illustrate the affinity of geotextiles with water under different conditions. This paper also presents an evaluation of the current state of knowledge regarding the hydrophobic/hydrophilic properties of geotextiles under unsaturated conditions. Often, geotextiles are used as filters, separators, or drains without proper verification of some of the basic principles for selecting and installing the product, and thus some minimum and important requirements may be ignored. Although in most cases there are no serious problems, sometimes the accumulation of a few centimeters of water over drainage systems may compromise the stability of geotechnical structures if this condition is not considered in the design. It has been observed that some of the test procedures reviewed do not take into account the hydrophobic/hydrophilic characteristics of the geotextiles.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Dewatering of sludge from a sewage treatment plant with geotextile tubes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: It is observed that most, if not all, human activities contemplate the use of water,and for sanitation this statement could not be more correct. However, the reality of the treatment of sanitary effluents is still precarious, where the sewage treatment plants usually discharge their effluents directly into the water bodies, without any previous treatment, disregarding the current regulations. In this context, dewatering solutions for those effluents are interesting, representingthe separation of the solid phase from the liquid, providing a more efficient transport and disposition for the solid particulate and, also, the correct treatment for the percolate, either through its return to the water bodies or to the beginning of the treatment process of the plant. Thus, this article addresses the suitability of a sewage treatment drying bed for the reception of geotextile tubes, aiming at the cleaning of silted stabilization ponds, making the dewatering of the dredged effluent faster and allowing the storage of a larger volume of sludge than the previous system. The dewatering process was performed by pumping the effluent from the stabilization ponds, with initial solids contents of approximately 5%, into the geotextile tubes. 14 tubes were used, contemplating the dewatering of more than 12.000m³, estimating the reduction in more than 8,5timesin relation to this initial volume. The dewatering was a success, where the 14 geotextile tubes of 10m perimeterand15m length were able to receive the desired dredged volume, separating the solid particulate from the water, providing great volume reduction, adequate encapsulation and revitalization of the stabilization ponds

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Influence of the slurry initial conditions on the dewatering process evaluated by falling-head column test
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Influence of the slurry initial conditions on the dewatering process evaluated by falling-head column test

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Geotextiles Closed Systems, GCS, has been used to dewatering a variety of high-water content sediments aiming to reduce the final volume of the residue at disposal. The geotextile retention capability to form a filter-cake that does not involve an excessive reduction of the hydraulic conductivity of the system is determinant to the success of the dewatering process. In addition, the grain size distribution of the solid phase, GSD, is tightly related to this success. There are two distinguishable phases in the process: the initial phase in which geotextile permeability controls the flow rate, and the post-filter-cake formation phase in which the retained sediments start to control the flow rate. The GSD play an important role in the retention of particles with a diameter smaller than the characteristic geotextile opening size by interlocking small particles between the bigger ones retained by the geotextile. However, it is difficult to determine how sensitive the dewatering process is to GSD variation. This work presented a discussion on how the increment in the coarse fraction of the GSD affects the filter-cake formation. The paper discusses the results of the falling-head column test performed to evaluate the behavior of a woven geotextile in the dewatering process of sediment with different GSD, in a turbulent flow condition at low initial solids content. The tests also evaluated the solids concentration in the effluent and water content in retained material. The obtained results indicate that a small amount of coarse material is sufficient to initiate the filter cake formation and has a greater impact on the effluent quality.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Geotextiles Closed Systems, GCS, has been used to dewatering a variety of high-water content sediments aiming to reduce the final volume of the residue at disposal. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Influence of the Test Method on Tensile Properties of Thin Polymeric Geosynthetic Barriers
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Influence of the Test Method on Tensile Properties of Thin Polymeric Geosynthetic Barriers

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Several engineering applications employing polymeric geosynthetic barriers need to have their tensile properties determined with confidence, according to standard test procedures that do not allow erroneous interpretations and decisions. However, there is no consensus on the standard test indicated to determine the tensile behavior of thin geomembranes in several recommendations and specifications in use. The paper compares the procedure adopted by American, International and Brazilian standards, and the results obtained in tests with PVC and fPP thin geomembranes. ABNT NBR 15826 and ISO 527-3 have the same procedure and present the most reliable results. ASTM D882 presents results closed with ISO results but with a lightly greater dispersion. ASTM D6693 presents a large dispersion of the results, and significant differences in percent elongation at break, with results 40% lower than ISO 527-3.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Several engineering applications employing polymeric geosynthetic barriers need to have their tensile properties determined with confidence, according to standard test procedures that do not allow erroneous interpretations and decisions. However, there is no consensus on the standard test indicated to determine the tensile behavior of thin geomembranes in several recommendations and specifications in use. The paper compares the procedure adopted by American, International and Brazilian standards, and the results obtained in tests with PVC and fPP thin geomembranes. ABNT NBR 15826 and ISO 527-3 have the same procedure and present the most reliable results. ASTM D882 presents results closed with ISO results but with a lightly greater dispersion. ASTM D6693 presents a large dispersion of the results, and significant differences in percent elongation at break, with results 40% lower than ISO 527-3.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Hydraulic behavior of unsaturated nonwoven geotextiles under hydrostatic pressure tests
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Hydraulic behavior of unsaturated nonwoven geotextiles under hydrostatic pressure tests

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nonwoven geotextiles have been widely used in geotechnical and environmental engineering applications for separation, filtration, and drainage. However, the literature reports that geotextiles may exhibit resistance to water penetration at initial wetting. Despite the initial wettability deficiency tends to disappear once wetted, the wetting problems of the fabric could deeply disturb the drainage system operation, particularly in applications in which geotextiles may perform for a considerable time in an unsaturated condition and under wetting and drying cycles, like capillary barriers and thin cover layers. Nowadays, only EN 13562 requires the unsaturated behavior evaluation of a geotextile subjected to hydrostatic pressure. Nonwoven geotextiles specimens generally present a specific behavior with a different wet area, even if the test results do not have a great variation. This process is governed by many geotextile intrinsic characteristics beyond polymer, as geotextile structure and the manufacturing process. The scope of this paper is to discuss the behavior of nonwoven geotextiles in these tests, comparing the specimen wet area registered in hydrostatic pressure tests.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nonwoven geotextiles have been widely used in geotechnical and environmental engineering applications for separation, filtration, and drainage. However, the literature reports that geotextiles may exhibit resistance to water penetration at initial wetting. Despite the initial wettability deficiency tends to disappear once wetted, the wetting problems of the fabric could deeply disturb the drainage system operation, particularly in applications in which geotextiles may perform for a considerable time in an unsaturated condition and under wetting and drying cycles, like capillary barriers and thin cover layers. Nowadays, only EN 13562 requires the unsaturated behavior evaluation of a geotextile subjected to hydrostatic pressure. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Geomembrane under Severe Environmental Conditions ? A Mining Application
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Geomembrane under Severe Environmental Conditions ? A Mining Application

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Derived from landfill practice, the application of liners to control seepage from Tailings Storage Facilities (TSF) has increased over the years. Environmental acceptability of liner design will depend on post closure, long-term performance and contingency measures, and can be a key environmental issue in TSF permitting. The suitability of geosynthetics for long-term applications for waste containment in the mining industry is still being scrutinized. While short and medium term (up to ~ 30 years) geosynthetics performance data is available in various situations, long-term field performance data is non-existent and, to date, available predictions have been based primarily on laboratory tests and modeling. These factors may be contributing reasons for the limited use of geosynthetics to address long-term issues such as the control of Metal Leaching (ML) and acid rock drainage (ARD). In order to bring contribution to the understanding of field performance of liners applied to control seepage in a TSF for leach tailings containment, this paper presents results from mechanical assessments on an exhumed HDPE geomembrane submitted during a year to several environmental conditions, such as UV exposure, changes temperature, changes in pH and changes in mechanical stress, that in synergy can accelerate degradation.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Derived from landfill practice, the application of liners to control seepage from Tailings Storage Facilities (TSF) has increased over the years. The suitability of geosynthetics for long-term applications for waste containment in the mining industry is still being scrutinized. While short and medium term (up to ~ 30 years) geosynthetics performance data is available in various situations, long-term field performance data is non-existent and, to date, available predictions have been based primarily on laboratory tests and modeling. These factors may be contributing reasons for the limited use of geosynthetics to address long-term issues such as the control of Metal Leaching (ML) and acid rock drainage (ARD). In order to bring contribution to the understanding of field performance of liners applied to control seepage in a TSF for leach tailings containment, this paper presents results from mechanical assessments on an exhumed HDPE geomembrane submitted during a year to several environmental conditions, such as UV exposure, changes temperature, changes in pH and changes in mechanical stress, that in synergy can accelerate degradation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical study on reinforced soil structures over areas susceptible to subsidence
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Numerical study on reinforced soil structures over areas susceptible to subsidence

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th Pan American Conference on Geosynthetics - GeoAmericas2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of geosynthetics as reinforcement at the base of embankments or other structures can provide safety operation for highways, railways or other facilities located in areas susceptible to subsidence. Few approaches are available for the design, and few studies have compared the results. To address this need, the current work uses finite element analysis to compare the basis for design and the results of existing approaches with numerical modeling. Axisymmetric analysis were carried out varying geometric and geomechanical parameters of the models. The results evaluated in the comparison include tensile force and strain responses of the reinforcement, reinforcement displacements and surface deflection. The findings contribute to the discussion on the safety of structures in areas prone to subsidence

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nova proposta de critério de retenção para dimensionamento de filtros têxteis

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIDAL, D. M.;DE MATTOS VIDAL, D.;VIDAL, D.M.;VIDAL, D.;MATTOS VIDAL, D.;Vidal, Delma;MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;DE MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;MATTOS VIDAL;Vidal, D.;Vidal, Delma de Mattos;MATTOS VIDAL,

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Novos Materiais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: o trabalho apresenta uma adaptação da teoria de Silveira aos filtros em geotêxtil e a metodologia para determinação das propriedades características do produto necessárias ao dimensionamento, permitindo estabelecer o nível de confiança de retenção de uma determinada partícula do solo base pelo geotêxtil especificado. Exemplos de caracterização do geotêxtil e aplicação do critéio de retenção são apresentados a fim de facilitar a compreensão do processo proposto.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Transporte, armazenagem e correio

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Um laboratório de ensaios capaz de atender as necessidades
de uma concessionária no que se refere a serviços de manutenção
ou implantação é um importante aliado para atingir
as metas e contribuir para a evolução da tecnologia rodoviária.
Ele atua em todas as fases dos serviços necessários ao bom
desempenho da via (projeto, controle de qualidade e monitoramento),
no treinamento de equipes técnicas de modo a
garantir a qualidade dos ensaios e no desenvolvimento de
pesquisas. Este artigo tem por objetivo discutir o cenário atual
no Brasil no que se refere aos laboratórios e ensaios mais realizados/
solicitados pelas concessionárias, os quesitos para a
implantação de laboratórios que atendam suas necessidades,
e os procedimentos para garantir a qualidade de suas atividades,
incluindo um exemplo de programa interlaboratorial.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Numerical Analysis of Reinforcement Strains at Failure for Reinforced Embankments over Soft Soils
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Numerical Analysis of Reinforcement Strains at Failure for Reinforced Embankments over Soft Soils

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Abstract.
The use of geosynthetics as basal reinforcement in embankments constructed over soft soils provides technical and economic benefits by improving the stability of the structure, reducing horizontal displacements, homogenizing
differential settlements, and reducing time of construction. An adequate design should include, however, more than routine limit equilibrium analyses, and should focus on understanding the soil-reinforcement interaction and mobilization of
reinforcement strains during construction and with time, aspects that can be assessed with the use of finite elements simulations. This article presents the results of finite elements simulations for a hypothetical embankment over soft soil,
applying the conceptual framework developed by Rowe & Soderman (1987), Rowe
et al.(1995) and Hinchberger & Rowe (2003). Two approximate methods for obtaining the reinforcement allowable compatible strain at failure without the need
for numerical simulations also are compared and discussed. The results in this article highlight the importance of assessing the mobilization of reinforcement strains during construction and taking into account soil-reinforcement interaction, given that reinforcement strains must be compatible with the soil system. An important implication, often overlooked in the past, is that the specification of geosynthetic materials for this application should be based on a minimum reinforcement stiffness modulus, i.e., the ultimate strength of the material may not suffice as a specification parameter.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The use of geosynthetics as basal reinforcement in embankments constructed over soft soils provides technical
and economic benefits by improving the stability of the structure, reducing horizontal displacements, homogenizing
differential settlements, and reducing time of construction. An adequate design should include, however, more than routine
limit equilibrium analyses, and should focus on understanding the soil-reinforcement interaction and mobilization of
reinforcement strains during construction and with time, aspects that can be assessed with the use of finite elements
simulations. This article presents the results of finite elements simulations for a hypothetical embankment over soft soil,
applying the conceptual framework developed by Rowe & Soderman (1987), Rowe
et al.
(1995) and Hinchberger & Rowe
(2003). Two approximate methods for obtaining the reinforcement allowable compatible strain at failure without the need
for numerical simulations also are compared and discussed. The results in this article highlight the importance of assessing
the mobilization of reinforcement strains during construction and taking into account soil-reinforcement interaction, given
that reinforcement strains must be compatible with the soil system. An important implication, often overlooked in the past,
is that the specification of geosynthetic materials for this application should be based on a minimum reinforcement
stiffness modulus,
i.e.
, the ultimate strength of the material may not suffice as a specification parameter.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Influence of sand addition in the early stage retention of fine sludge dewatering by geotextile
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Influence of sand addition in the early stage retention of fine sludge dewatering by geotextile

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The need to investigate viable methods to facilitate correct disposal of high-water content waste is immediate in the scenario of water source degradation. In this context, Closed Geotextile Systems (CGS) have shown promise for dewatering a variety of high water-content sediments, aiming to reduce the waste final volume, encapsulating particles, and at the same time allowing fluid drainage. Especially in Water Treatment Plants, the geotextiles generally employed in these systems have good tensile strength and rigidity to support mechanical solicitations and hydraulic properties that warrant good drainage conditions. In these applications, the geotextile element should assure the waste confinement and retention of some particles that will form a filter cake which will control internal flow conditions. The present work investigated how small portions of sand influence fine-particle retention. The sludge used consisted of a mixture of filtered water with two well-defined fractions of ground quartz: FG, a silt and CG, a fine sand. The results show that small amounts of sand are capable of leading to the formation of a pre-filter, even if the maximum diameter of the fine particles is much less than the geotextile filtration opening size. The test results indicate that the retention efficiency gradually increases as CG increases in the solution, up to a fraction of CG close to 14%, which represents only 0.7% of the total solution mass. The increase in particle retention was directly proportional to the increase in the GC fraction until reaching the filtration efficiency of approximately 72% where it stabilizes.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The need to investigate viable methods to facilitate correct disposal of high-water content waste is immediate in the scenario of water source degradation. In this context, Closed Geotextile Systems (CGS) have shown promise for dewatering a variety of high water-content sediments, aiming to reduce the waste final volume, encapsulating particles, and at the same time allowing fluid drainage. Especially in Water Treatment Plants, the geotextiles generally employed in these systems have good tensile strength and rigidity to support mechanical solicitations and hydraulic properties that warrant good drainage conditions. In these applications, the geotextile element should assure the waste confinement and retention of some particles that will form a filter cake which will control internal flow conditions. The present work investigated how small portions of sand influence fine-particle retention. The sludge used consisted of a mixture of filtered water with two well-defined fractions of ground quartz: FG, a silt and CG, a fine sand. The results show that small amounts of sand are capable of leading to the formation of a pre-filter, even if the maximum diameter of the fine particles is much less than the geotextile filtration opening size. The test results indicate that the retention efficiency gradually increases as CG increases in the solution, up to a fraction of CG close to 14%, which represents only 0.7% of the total solution mass. The increase in particle retention was directly proportional to the increase in the GC fraction until reaching the filtration efficiency of approximately 72% where it stabilizes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Comparison between Open and Closed System for Dewatering with Geotextile: Field and Comparative Study
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Comparison between Open and Closed System for Dewatering with Geotextile: Field and Comparative Study

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Civil and Environmental Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The present paper aims to expose two techniques of dewatering for sludge, analyzing its operations and dewatering processes, aiming at improving the conditions of disposal of residues with high liquid content. It describes the field tests performed on two geotextile systems, a closed geotextile tube and an open geotextile 
drying bed, both of which are submitted to two filling cycles.

drying bed, both of which are submitted to two filling cycles.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste primeiro relatório foram abordados os princípios de funcionamento de um sistema drenante com utilização de produtos geotêxteis na função de filtração e apresentados, brevemente, os tipos de materiais comumente utilizados, suas características e alguns critérios de dimensionamento. Também são mencionados métodos de classificação do solo quanto ao comportamento durante filtração.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Este relatório apresenta o dimensionamento e especificação realizados para os solos selecionados pelo LACTEC e os resultados dos ensaios executados até março de 2006. Como ainda não está terminada toda a caracterização dos solos e dos geossintéticos, a verificação da aprovação do geotêxtil pelos critérios de retenção/colmatação e de permeabilidade com as propriedades determinadas em laboratório será apresentada no próximo relatório técnico. Este relatório faz a análise considerando as propriedades índice indicadas pelo fabricante para os solos recebidos no ITA.
	O LACTEC selecionou 30 solos para a pesquisa, sendo que uma avaliação prévia das características dos solos escolhidos permitiu selecionar 13 amostras deste conjunto para análise quanto à filtração. Uma destas amostras corresponde ao solo utilizado no dreno experimental realizado em Curitiba.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: apoio a projeto

PROGRAMA CURSO - Geossintéticos no reforço de solos e pavimentos
Proposta para Huesker - curso de 16h em julho/2006

Objetivos: Apresentar os produtos e soluções que os geossintéticos oferecem à engenharia geotécnica e os principais conceitos, mecanismos e linhas gerais de projeto e especificação para aplicações em reforço de solos e pavimentos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-CURSOS-CURTA-DURACAO-MI.TITULO: FUNCTIONS AND APPLICATIONS OF GEOSYNTHETICS IN TRANSPORTATION

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIDAL, D. M.;DE MATTOS VIDAL, D.;VIDAL, D.M.;VIDAL, D.;MATTOS VIDAL, D.;Vidal, Delma;MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;DE MATTOS VIDAL, DELMA;MATTOS VIDAL;Vidal, D.;Vidal, Delma de Mattos;MATTOS VIDAL,

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Geosynthetics are largely applied in geotechnical works related to transportation. Airports, railways and roads employ them in several functions: filtration, drainage, erosion control, moisture barriers, separation and reinforcement.
 Drains and filters, such as geonets, geospacers and geotextiles, are used to preserve pavement properties and to collect and conduct superficial and underground water. Geomats can be used to prevent superficial erosion in slopes.
 Moisture barriers, generally made from asphalt-impregnated geotextiles, can be used to construct economical pavement bases, with poor granular or clayey soils, in rural areas or in regions where there is a lack of granular materials. Also, they avoid water penetration in base and sub-base materials in wet areas.
 Geotextiles acting as separators preserve adjacent material properties in clayey/granular material interfaces present in embankments, pavements and railways.
 Geotextiles and geogrids are used to stabilize low bearing capacity soils, allowing traffic of construction equipment, in either temporary or permanent works. Pavements, bridge abutments, walls, slopes and embankments reinforced with these geosynthetics provide high technical solutions in very difficult conditions. Stiff and high tensile strength geosynthetics can solve problems which otherwise would be quite expensive to solve. 
 Reinforced overlays prevent cracking propagation and allows an important increase in service life. Base and sub-base reinforcement improve bearing capacity and the base/sub-base material properties.
 A basal reinforcement in embankments over soft soils, karstic regions or old mining areas, assures stability, preserves the embankment integrity and improves the stress distribution leading to uniform settlements. 
 Reinforced bridge abutments, walls and steep slopes are compatible with recent needs of building in reduced working areas and in difficult terrains.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Geossintéticos são produtos industrializados poliméricos (sintéticos ou naturais), cujas propriedades contribuem para melhoria de obras geotécnicas, nas quais eles desempenham principalmente funções de: reforço, filtração, drenagem, proteção, separação, controle de fluxo (impermeabilização) e controle de erosão superficial.
A grande versatilidade destes produtos, associada ao desenvolvimento tecnológico das últimas décadas, os torna presentes e indispensáveis em praticamente todas as obras geotécnicas da atualidade, permitindo reduzir custos e prazos, facilitar os procedimentos e melhorar a confiabilidade. Suas propriedades os tornam também grandes aliados dos geotécnicos na solução ou na prevenção de problemas ambientais.
Além disto, o desenvolvimento de produtos de elevada rigidez ou com propriedades específicas, vem permitindo resolver problemas considerados de difícil solução, seja pelos altos custos de uma proposta convencional ou pela amplitude das solicitações ou das restrições impostas.

 	Fundações rasas e reforço de áreas com risco de subsidência.

O VI E_GGGAITA aconteceu dia 27 de setembro das 13:30 as 17:30h, apresentando trabalhos de participantes do GGGAITA, seus egressos e convidados. O evento é aberto a toda a comunidade e recebeu cerca de 45 participantes entre professores, estudantes, ex-alunos e profissionais da região, cujas palestras estão disponíveis no site www.ggaita.civil.ita.br.

O VII E_GGGAITA aconteceu dia 31 de outubro das 13:30 as 17:30h, tendo por tema o Congresso Internacional de Berlim que apresentou além de uma análise das publicações do 10ICG (Avaliação dos principais temas e palestras, Interação solo/geogrelha e reforço de lastro ferroviário, Modelagem e reforço de solos, Barreiras geossintéticas argilosas) e reapresentação de trabalhos publicados por participantes do GGGAITA e seus egressos, O evento é aberto a toda a comunidade e recebe 48 participantes entre professores, estudantes, ex-alunos e profissionais da região.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Evento anual ocorrido em 16 de setembro de 2016, comemorativo dos 30 anos de pesquisas em geossintéticos no ITA, com cerca de 60 participantes. 
O encontro deste ano foi dividido em dois blocos:
Bloco A (manhã) "Pesquisas em andamento" composto por 4 mesas redondas
I ? Hidrogeologia ? coordenador Laura Borma (INPE)
II ? Contenção e tratamento de lodos e solos contaminados ? coordenador Paulo Hemsi (ITA)
III ? Reforços com GSY - coordenador Paulo Brugger (Brugger Eng.)
IV ? Durabilidade de GSY ? coordenador Paulo Ivo Queiroz (ITA)
Bloco B - Encontro Técnico
-The behavior of ?alive" earthworks with geosynthetics after several decades - Jean Pierre Gourc (Prof Emérito Univ.Grenoble Alpes França ? homenagem pelo apoio às pesquisas)
-Talude reforçado da SP 123 - Uma estrutura no Brasil com mais de 30 anos - Demetrius Guimarãoes (egresso BIDIM)
-Pedágio da Tamoios ? Uma grande estrutura de solo reforçado recente - André Estevão Silva (egresso HUESKER)
-Avanços no processo de normatização e recomendações no país - Delma Vidal (ITA)
-Aplicação de GCL em áreas de mineração - Indiara Giugni (consultora)
-Testes em materiais reativos para remediação de plumas de contaminação in situ- Paulo Hemsi (ITA)
30 anos no Caminho - Yukishigue Okasaki (homenagem pelo apoio aos primeiros projetos em 1986)
